org.supremica.automata.IO
Class ProjectBuildFromWaters

java.lang.Object
  org.supremica.automata.IO.ProjectBuildFromWaters

public class ProjectBuildFromWaters
extends java.lang.Object

A converter that translates the WATERS ProductDESProxy interfaces into Supremica's Project classes.

Constructor Summary
ProjectBuildFromWaters(net.sourceforge.waters.model.marshaller.DocumentManager manager)
          Creates a WATERS-to-Supremica converter using a default project factory.
ProjectBuildFromWaters(net.sourceforge.waters.model.marshaller.DocumentManager manager, ProjectFactory factory)
          Creates a WATERS-to-Supremica converter.
 
Method Summary
 Automaton build(net.sourceforge.waters.model.des.AutomatonProxy aut)
          Converts a WATERS automaton to a Supremica automaton.
 Project build(net.sourceforge.waters.model.module.ModuleProxy module)
          Converts a WATERS module to a Supremica project.
 Project build(net.sourceforge.waters.model.des.ProductDESProxy des)
          Converts a WATERS product DES to a Supremica project.
 Alphabet buildAlphabet(java.util.Collection<? extends net.sourceforge.waters.model.des.EventProxy> events)
          Converts a collection of WATERS events to a Supremica alphabet.

Constructor Detail

ProjectBuildFromWaters

public ProjectBuildFromWaters(net.sourceforge.waters.model.marshaller.DocumentManager manager)
Creates a WATERS-to-Supremica converter using a default project factory.

Parameters:
manager - The document manager used when compiling Waters modules. This argument must be provided and reference a document manager that is properly initialised to load modules. To support proper caching, the document manager should be shared throughout the application.

ProjectBuildFromWaters

public ProjectBuildFromWaters(net.sourceforge.waters.model.marshaller.DocumentManager manager,
                              ProjectFactory factory)
Creates a WATERS-to-Supremica converter.

Parameters:
manager - The document manager used when compiling WATERS modules. This argument must be provided and reference a document manager that is properly initialised to load modules. To support proper caching, the document manager should be shared throughout the application.
factory - The project factory used to create the Supremica automata.
Method Detail

build

public Project build(net.sourceforge.waters.model.module.ModuleProxy module)
              throws net.sourceforge.waters.model.expr.EvalException
Converts a WATERS module to a Supremica project. This method uses a compiler to translate and instantiate the module, and then converts the resulting product DES.

Parameters:
module - The WATERS module to be converted.
Returns:
The module in Supremica form.
Throws:
net.sourceforge.waters.model.expr.EvalException - to indicate that compilation of the module has failed.

build

public Project build(net.sourceforge.waters.model.des.ProductDESProxy des)
              throws net.sourceforge.waters.model.expr.EvalException
Converts a WATERS product DES to a Supremica project.

Parameters:
des - The WATERS product DES to be converted.
Returns:
The product DES in Supremica form.
Throws:
net.sourceforge.waters.model.expr.EvalException - to indicate that the model could not be converted due to WATERS features not supported by Supremica.

build

public Automaton build(net.sourceforge.waters.model.des.AutomatonProxy aut)
                throws net.sourceforge.waters.model.expr.EvalException
Converts a WATERS automaton to a Supremica automaton.

Parameters:
aut - The WATERS automaton to be converted.
Returns:
The automaton in Supremica form.
Throws:
net.sourceforge.waters.model.expr.EvalException - to indicate that the model could not be converted due to WATERS features not supported by Supremica.

buildAlphabet

public Alphabet buildAlphabet(java.util.Collection<? extends net.sourceforge.waters.model.des.EventProxy> events)
Converts a collection of WATERS events to a Supremica alphabet.

Parameters:
events - The WATERS events to be converted.
Returns:
An alphabet containing Supremica event labels corresponding to all the given events, except for the propositions.
